Detailed Description

A single occurence of a regular expression.

An AGRegexMatch represents a single occurence of a regular expression within the target string. The range of each subpattern within the target string is returned by -range, -rangeAtIndex:, or -rangeNamed:. The part of the target string that matched each subpattern is returned by -group, -groupAtIndex:, or -groupNamed:.

Member Function Documentation

- (int) count  

count The number of capturing subpatterns, including the pattern itself.

- (NSString *) group  

group Returns the part of the target string that matched the pattern.

- (NSString *) groupAtIndex: (int)  idx  

groupAtIndex: Returns the part of the target string that matched the subpattern at the given index or nil if it wasn't matched. The subpatterns are indexed in order of their opening parentheses, 0 is the entire pattern, 1 is the first capturing subpattern, and so on.

- (NSString *) groupNamed: (NSString *)  name  

groupNamed: Returns the part of the target string that matched the subpattern of the given name or nil if it wasn't matched.

- (NSRange) range  

range Returns the range of the target string that matched the pattern.

- (NSRange) rangeAtIndex: (int)  idx  

rangeAtIndex: Returns the range of the target string that matched the subpattern at the given index or {NSNotFound, 0} if it wasn't matched. The subpatterns are indexed in order of their opening parentheses, 0 is the entire pattern, 1 is the first capturing subpattern, and so on.

- (NSRange) rangeNamed: (NSString *)  name  

rangeNamed: Returns the range of the target string that matched the subpattern of the given name or {NSNotFound, 0} if it wasn't matched.

- (NSString *) string  

string Returns the target string.
